i1.name: Mana_Surge
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Xerath''' periodically empowers his next [[basic attack]] to restore {{pp|30;33;36;42;48;54;63;72;81;90;102;114;126;138;150;165;180;195|formula=27 + 3 at each level up to 3, then + 6 at each level up to 6, then + 9 at each level up to 10, 12 at each level up to 15, then + 15 at each level|color=mana}} {{sti|mana|{{as|mana}}}}, doubled to {{pp|60;66;72;84;96;108;126;144;162;180;204;228;252;276;300;330;360;390|formula=54 + 6 at each level up to 3, then + 12 at each level up to 6, then + 18 at each level up to 10, then + 24 at each level up to 15, then + 30 at each level|color=mana}} against enemy {{tip|champions}}.
''Mana Surge'' does not trigger if '''Xerath''' would restore above his {{as|'''maximum''' mana}}.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Xerath periodically empowers his next basic attack to restore 30;33;36;42;48;54;63;72;81;90;102;114;126;138;150;165;180;195 − undefined (based on level) mana, doubled to 60;66;72;84;96;108;126;144;162;180;204;228;252;276;300;330;360;390 − undefined (based on level) against enemy champions.
Mana Surge does not trigger if Xerath would restore above his maximum mana.
i1.notes:
* ''Mana Surge'' will trigger even if the attack is {{tip|blocked}}.
* The empowered attack will not trigger against [[structures]].
* {{Pending for test}}: ''Mana Surge's '' interactions with {{tip|dodge|dodging}}, and {{tip|blind|blinding}} effects.

q1.name: Arcanopulse
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Xerath''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to 3 seconds to increase ''Arcanopulse's'' {{sti|range}} over the first {{fd|1.5}} to {{fd|1.75}} seconds of the channel while being {{tip|slow|slowed}} by {{pp|key=%|type=channel time|0;10;15;20;25;30;35;40|0 to 1.75|formula=10% after 0 to 0.25 seconds, then {{plus}}5% per 0.25 seconds channeled, capped at 40%}}. ''Arcanopulse'' can be recast at any time within its duration.
If the charge completes without reactivation or is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, ''Arcanopulse'' is cancelled, refunding {{sti|mana|{{as|half of its mana cost}}}}.
{{sbc|Recast:}} After a delay of {{rutngt|0.5}}, '''Xerath''' fires a beam of energy in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies within the area.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Xerath charges for up to 3 seconds to increase Arcanopulse's range over the first 1.5 to 1.75 seconds of the channel while being slowed by 0 to 1.75 ‒ undefined. Arcanopulse can be recast at any time within its duration.
If the charge completes without reactivation or is interrupted, Arcanopulse is cancelled, refunding half of its mana cost.
Recast: After a delay of 0.528, Xerath fires a beam of energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies within the area.
q1.notes:
* The onset of ''Arcanopulse's'' self-{{tip|slow}} and first range increase is at a random interval of 0 to {{fd|0.25}} seconds. The real time to maximum self-slow and range is thus {{fd|1.5}} to {{fd|1.75}} seconds.
* The rectangle hitbox's minimum range is {{tip|er|icononly = true}} 0, right through '''Xerath's''' center.
* ''Arcanopulse'' will still fire and deal damage if '''Xerath''' dies during the {{rutngt|0.5}} recast delay.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Xerath''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|charge|attack=false|move=true|cast=false|items=false|consume=Disabled, but can still use trinkets.|spells=true, true, false, false, recasts}}

w1.name: Eye_of_Destruction
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Xerath''' calls down a blast of arcane energy upon the target location which strikes after {{rutngt|0.5}}, briefly granting {{tip|sight}} of the area and dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies within and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 25% for {{fd|2.5}} seconds.
Enemies in the center of the blast take {{fd|66.7}}% increased [[damage]] and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by a greater amount, decaying to 25% over the duration.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Xerath calls down a blast of arcane energy upon the target location which strikes after 0.528, briefly granting sight of the area and dealing magic damage to all enemies within and slowing them by 25% for 2.5 seconds.
Enemies in the center of the blast take 66.7% increased damage and are slowed by a greater amount, decaying to 25% over the duration.

effects.str:
• Enhanced Damage: (+ % AP)
  • Enhanced Slow: %

e1.name: Shocking_Orb
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Xerath''' fires an orb of energy in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{pp|type=distance the orb traveled|0.75 to 2.25 for 11|0 to 1050|formula=0.75+(0.15 per 105 units). ''This is capped at 1050 units traveled.''}} seconds.
e1.descriptionHtml: Active: Xerath fires an orb of energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and stunning them for 0 to 1050 ‒ undefined seconds.

r1.name: Rite_of_the_Arcane
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Xerath''' {{tip|channel|channels}} for up to 10 seconds, unleashing his true power, gaining the ability to recast ''Rite of the Arcane'' multiple times after {{fd|0.5}} seconds within its duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Xerath''' launches a blast of arcane energy to the target location which strikes after {{rutngt|0.6}}, briefly granting {{tip|sight}} of the area and dealing {{as|magic damage}} to enemies within. Each cast has a {{tt|static cooldown|Unaffected by ability haste}} of {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
If none of the recasts were used and ''Rite of the Arcane's'' channel times out or '''Xerath''' manually interrupts it, half of the ability's {{sti|cooldown}} is refunded.
'''Xerath''' will {{tip|sight|reveal}} himself if a barrage lands to an area within a distance of an enemy.
''Rite of the Arcane's recast will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Xerath channels for up to 10 seconds, unleashing his true power, gaining the ability to recast Rite of the Arcane multiple times after 0.5 seconds within its duration.
Recast: Xerath launches a blast of arcane energy to the target location which strikes after 0.627, briefly granting sight of the area and dealing magic damage to enemies within. Each cast has a static cooldown of 0.5 seconds.
If none of the recasts were used and Rite of the Arcane's channel times out or Xerath manually interrupts it, half of the ability's cooldown is refunded.
Xerath will reveal himself if a barrage lands to an area within a distance of an enemy.
Rite of the Arcane's recast will cast at max range if cast beyond that.
r1.notes:
* Each cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
* The recast is named ''Arcane Barrage''.
* A circular indicator will be displayed at the target location to signify that the area will be blasted.
* A circle indicating the ability's maximum range forms on the map over 1 second (starting small and rapidly expanding to the maximum range over the delay) for the channel's duration.
** The maximum-range indicator is visible to both allies and enemies and is color coded for friendly (blue) or hostile (red).
* ''Rite of the Arcane'' uses a [[Champion ability|barrage system]] so that it can be recast multiple times within a given period at no additional cost.
* '''Xerath''' will turn to face toward the direction of the target location after using a recast.
* '''Xerath''' gains a wider field of view during ''Rite of the Arcane''.
* '''Xerath''' can use {{ai|Dark Passage|Thresh}} while channeling.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Xerath''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|cast=false|attack=interrupts|move=Disabled for the first {{fd|1.25}} seconds, otherwise, interrupts.|items=interrupts,true,,false|spells=true, false, interrupts, interrupts, false}}
* {{si|Teleport}} is disabled for the first {{fd|1.25}} seconds of the channel.
